response_parsed.title: Combining Curses with Typing for Production Code in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide demonstrates how to leverage the power of both the curses and typing libraries in Python 3.12+ to create a user-friendly command-line interface while ensuring type safety.
key_points: Understanding the basics of curses and typing libraries
Creating a custom CommandLineInterface class with typing for type checking
Implementing cursor movement, color management, and screen manipulation using curses
Demonstrating a simple command-line application as an example

code_examples.code:
```
from typing import List, Callable, Optional
import curses

class CommandLineInterface:
    def __init__(self, height: int, width: int):
        self.stdscr = curses.initscr()
        self.height, self.width = height, width
        self.curses_colors = [curses.COLOR_BLACK, curses.COLOR_RED, curses.COLOR_GREEN]
        curses.start_color()
        for i in range(len(self.curses_colors)):
            curses.init_pair(i + 1, self.curses_colors[i], curses.COLOR_WHITE)
    # ... (method definitions omitted for brevity) 
```
